Speaker: macgowan
Dialogue: We need your assistance!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: C'mon, Mac... It's the first bite I've had all week...

Speaker: macgowan
Dialogue: Please... It's very importantl...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Do you value our friendship, Mac?

Speaker: macgowan
Dialogue: More than me' nightly pint.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Then this better not be some wild goose chase...

Speaker: macgowan
Dialogue: T'ain't wild geese we're after, Doctor Jones. You got me' word on that...  ...and a MacGowan's word is truer than an angel's kiss!

Speaker: young man
Dialogue: Scotty Ferguson.

Speaker: old woman
Dialogue: He's the eighth.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Just like the others...all his bones busted...crushed...

Speaker: old man
Dialogue: Whatever's killin' people around here ain't human.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: It's there! Again!

Speaker: macgowan
Dialogue: That light...only burns after a murder's been committed.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Let's go.

Speaker: macgowan
Dialogue: Well... Ahmmmm...that is what we're here for...eh, men?...ah...  Hennesey... Galbraith... Bottomley... You're comin' with us.

Speaker: elderly woman
Dialogue: May God help them.

Speaker: hennesey
Dialogue: It's deathly cold in 'ere. How could a human bein' survive?...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: This guy's got one hell of an ego.

Speaker: macgowan
Dialogue: Baron Seamus Seagrove III. Some say 'e walks the moors every midnight... others claim e's been dead for years...

Speaker: macgowan
Dialogue: Hennesey?... Hennesey?...

Speaker: galbraith
Dialogue: 'E was standin' right 'ere! Just a second ago... Standin' right beside me!...

Speaker: macgowan
Dialogue: Thanks for catchin' me.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: I'd rather be catchin' trout.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Interesting blood type...

Speaker: galbraith
Dialogue: Look!

Speaker: macgowan
Dialogue: Galbraith... You come with me! We'll search for Hennesey... Out here! Bottomley... You go with Doctor Jones...  In there.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Let's get outta' here.

Speaker: bottomley
Dialogue: Inspector MacGowan! Galbraith! Open the door!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: I need more light.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Bottomley?...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Bottomley?...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Who is it?... Who's there?...

Speaker: macgowan
Dialogue: Doctor Jones! Try to push!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Can't! There's some kinda' hot ice coverin' the...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: NOW they bite!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Excuse me, sir...? Hello...?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Canyou hear me?...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Listen, pal... There are two dead Policemen upstairs and...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Chow time's over, mister. You better start talkin'.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: There's a lot of strange things happening around here...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: ...and I want some answers! Do you hear me?  I want some answers! Now!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Haven't you had enough?

Speaker: macgowan
Dialogue: Now you can get back to your fishing, Doctor Jones.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: No chance, Mac. My plane leaves in the morning. Vacation's over. Gotta' get back to school.

Speaker: macgowan
Dialogue: Tell ya' what, my friend... I fancy me'self quite the fisherman... Tomorrow, I'll go out and catch you a real beauty, eh?...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Right. Send it to me airmail.

Speaker: macgowan
Dialogue: Doctor Jones! A MacGowan's word is truer than...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah...an angel's kiss. I know.

Speaker: baron seagrove
Dialogue: No...jail...can...hold...me.

Speaker: villager
Dialogue: 'E's done it! Indiana Jones has captured the killer!

Speaker: macgowan
Dialogue: What is it, man? You look as if you've seen a screamin' banshee!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Ah... It was nothing, Mac. Nothing at all.

Speaker: teddy
Dialogue: Doctor Jones... I took your class instead of all the others!... I coulda' had Professor Needles... Professor Eisenschmidt... Professor...

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: You promised. You said you'd have 'em graded by yesterday.

Speaker: virgil
Dialogue: My paper finished yet? Name's "Virgil Vektor". That's VIRGIL.  Capital V... I... R...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: My parents paid good money to send me here. You know how much they shelled out for your class?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: He doesn't care about us. He only wants fame and fortune. We're just a buncha' peons to him.

Speaker: virgil
Dialogue: VEKTOR. Capital V... E... K...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Hello, Ind --  Doctor Jones.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Not now, Betsy.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: LOOK at all of those papers!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Please, I...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Want me to come by later? Help you grade?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Help me grade. Yeah. Sure.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Goodbye, Ind --  Doctor Jones!

Speaker: virgil
Dialogue: Didja' get the name? VIRGIL! Capital V... I... R...

Speaker: priestly
Dialogue: Moby Dick.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Huh?...

Speaker: priestly
Dialogue: That's what I named 'im. Captain said it was the biggest fish he ever saw.

Speaker: priestly
Dialogue: What about you, Jonesey? You were over in Scotty-land for two weeks... Didja' catch the big one?...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Look, Priestly... I'm real busy...

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Two-timing bastard!

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: How could you?!?... My own Mother?!?... In my own bed?!?...  I've had it with you! It's over!

Speaker: dean coventry
Dialogue: Doctor Jones, I've had complaints from several of the students --

Speaker: postman
Dialogue: Sign here.

Speaker: dean coventry
Dialogue: They feel that you are ignoring them, that you are distracted...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Me?... Distracted?...

Speaker: postman
Dialogue: What's this? "B+"? That's how you sign your name?

Speaker: dean coventry
Dialogue: Marshall University is not the place for sloppy behavior...

Speaker: dean coventry
Dialogue: I have one final warning for you, Doctor Jones --

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Yes... Oh, Hello, Marcus... Look, can you hold on?...  You were saying, sir?

Speaker: dean coventry
Dialogue: Either you begin concentrating on your --

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: I'm very sorry, sir...

Speaker: dean coventry
Dialogue: -- concentrating on your teaching duties or --

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: It is, huh?... Okay. Five minutes. Yeah. I'll be right over. But this better be important, Marcus!

Speaker: dean coventry
Dialogue: You are on probation, Jones! Ten days! If there is no improvement, you will be dismissed!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: I promise...by tomorrow...I'll have all of these graded...and DRIED!

Speaker: virgil
Dialogue: VIRGIL VEKTOR! Capital V... I... R...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: This better be important, Marcus... or the museum will soon be displaying my bones. My teaching career is in danger of extinction.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: You will not be disappointed, Indiana.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: "Sun wu Kung, The Stone Monkey King". Big deal. That was ten years ago, Marcus.  Geez! This Heller kid's got the worst grammar.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Ten years or fifty years. It will always be in your blood.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Don't believe this... He spells "repeat" with two "E's".

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Think back, Indiana. Remember your desire? Your passion?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Kid gets an "A" on content...a "D" on form.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Damn it, man! You can't bury those feelings forever!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Two years. Nearly two years of my life...looking for the remains of that Monkey...a piece of his legendary Golden Hooped Rod...or some sign of the Lost City.  We still came back empty handed.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: One mustn't give up so easily, Indiana.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Give up?!?... Marcus, we spent thirteen months in China!...another seven in India!...

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: But none in Africa.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: There was no proof...archeological or anthropological...to indicate that Sun Wu-Kung ever visited Africa...

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Until now.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Hey... My papers...

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: The woman is Dr. Clare Clarke. The famous zoologist. She works in Africa, studying animals in their natural habitat.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Very interesting, Marcus. Now if you'll turn the lights back on --

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Three weeks ago, Dr. Clarke discovered that cute little fellow... "Tyki"...a pygmy of an unusual race...unrelated to any known African tribe...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Marcus. The lights.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Dr. Clarke believes that Tyki comes from the Lost Civilization of Sun Wu-Kung.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: What?... But how did Miss --

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: "Doctor".

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: "Doctor" Clake. How did she arrive at such a preposterous hypothesis?

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: The pygmy speaks in a language that has no African origins...but bears a strong resemblance to Chinese.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Means nothing. The rivers of Africa have been plagued by various Oriental Pirates and Scavengers since the 16th Century.  Not much evidence, Marcus.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: There's more. The pygmy was found wearing an ornamental peach stone around his neck...believed to come from Sun Wu-Kung's legendary Garden Of Immortal Peaches.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: One tribe may wear peach stones... another may wear banana peels...

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: There is one final bit of evidence...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Enlighten me.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: The pygmy is over 200 years old.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: That's impossible.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Dr. Clarke has done a considerable amount of testing on the pygmy's clothing...his sandals...everything was over 200 years old.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: He's probably wearing his Great Grandfather's stuff.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: What does all of this have to do with me?

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Dr. Clarke wants to mount an expedition to find the Lost City of Sun Wu-Kung. She is quite familiar with your reputation...she'd like you to come along.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: No chance.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: There will be money involved... The museum is willing to fund the expedition...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Sorry, Marcus. I've burned this bridge.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Indiana...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Marcus. Please. I've got to finish these...

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: You've got to finish something much more important. You crossed the threshold over a decade ago...and it's been tearing at your insides ever since.  My friend, if there is even one iota of truth in Dr. Clarke's findings... then you can lift the veil of mystery that has surrounded this Chinese legend for Centuries. You may uncover the secrets to a Lost Civilization...and possibly, to man's never ending search for immortality.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Indiana... Can you afford to pass up the single most important adventure of your life?

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: You can't do this to me!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: C'mon, Betsy. Relax. You're gettin' 'em all wet again.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: You just can't go away...I mean... Africa is so far away, and...well...  I love you, Indy.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Thought we agreed this was s'posed to be casual...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: You call what happened last night "casual".

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: My dear...a momentary lapse into passion does not a love affair make.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Momentary lapse! So that's all I am to you!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Betsy... Wait...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Whatsa' matter with you!... Tryin' to ruin my whip!...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: If I can't have you... I don't want to live.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Drink this. You'll feel better.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: C'mon, Betsy... Get a hold of yourself. You're young. There are a lot of other guys...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Not like you.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Yeccchhh! I'll be disgusting.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Don't leave me, Indy!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Look... You're just a flighty kid. Twenty minutes after I walk out this door, you'll have a date with the college Romeo. Two hours from now, you'll be madly in love with him. By tomorrow, you'll forget I ever existed.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Never underestimate the determination of a Brooklyn girl, Doctor Jones. Never.

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Indy! At last we are reunited!  Oh, Keechingo, God Of Friendship...I thank you for granting my wish!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: I see you haven't changed, Scraggy.

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Mahootmek, God Of Goodness, say... "Before body make contact with foreign object...one must cast out bad spirits, or -- "

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: " -- or bad spirits will enter your body!"

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Yes! You have excellent memory, Indy.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: I should! Last time we saw each other...you made me wear the same clothes for 3 weeks straight.

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Never separate body from clothes, or bad spirits will hide in pockets!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: In other words... If people never changed clothes...there would be no evil in the world.

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Exactly!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: I missed all a' your crazy philosophies, Scraggy.

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: They not so crazy, Indy.  These days... There is much evil in the air. I feel it. Everywhere.

Speaker: gutterbuhg
Dialogue: Are we making contact?

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Dr. Clarke! Why you kick Dr. Jones?...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Dr. Jones! Forgive me.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: No sweat.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Thought I was being attacked by a degenerate sailor.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: No. Just a degenerate archeologist.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Your appearance is deceiving.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Likewise.

Speaker: porter
Dialogue: You left this aboard ship.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: There must be some mistake... I didn't --

Speaker: porter
Dialogue: That's you, ain't it?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Well, yeah...but...

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Indy! Remember Mahootmek, God Of Goodness! "Before body make contact with foreign object -- "

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: "...you must cast out bad spirits!"

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: May I call you "Clare"?

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Please.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Well, Clare... We've obviously got a lot of notes to compare... Let's get started tonight...over dinner.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: I'd like that very much.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Friend of mine owns a Cafe... He'll get us a nice quiet table. No disturbances. Just the two of us --

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: I warn you, Indy! You must always cast out bad spirits!

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: My precious!

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Your daughter?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: My assistant.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: His girlfriend.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: A child!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: What the hell are you doing here'?

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Proving my love for you.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: How terribly sordid.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Puppy love. Schoolgirl crush. She'll get over it.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Never. This proves that nothing can come between us. Not an ocean. Not two separate Continents.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Think I'm going to be ill.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: How...I mean... How could you stay alive?

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Hey... I'm from Brooklyn.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: But we'ye been sailing for three weeks!

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Stowed away in the banana barrel. Ate my way to the bottom.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Charming.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Hey, Indy... Who's the babe?

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Your intellectual and emotional superior.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Yeah...well you're gettin' on my nerves, Miss... Miss...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: "Doctor" Clare Clarke.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Betsy Tuffet...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: As in curds and whey?

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Listen, sister... You better stay away from Indy...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: My dear, he has no interest in me. I've already celebrated my tenth Birthday.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Look, Betsy... Why don't you get back on the boat... This time, as a passenger.

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Too late, Indy.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: When's the next one out?

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Two weeks.

Speaker: mephisto
Dialogue: Were you successful?

Speaker: mephisto
Dialogue: Keep a record of everything that is said.

Speaker: mephisto
Dialogue: Ever since our battle for the Lost Ark... The feuhrer has been very interested in the adventures of Indiana Jones. Very interested.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Tyki... This is Doctor Jones...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: He's a real gentleman.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: This is our guide, Scraggy Brier... and Miss Bets--

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: It appears that Bonzo is attracted to Miss Tuffet's Derfume... Eau De Banana Peel.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Where did you find him?...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: About ten miles from here. We were on a photographic expedition...in the thick of the jungle... I heard sounds. Whimpering. Moaning. I took a few steps, and found Tyki. He was lying in a shallow swamp...semi conscious...a high fever...nearly dead from exhaustion. He had obviously been travelling on foot for many days, over countless miles... So I brought him back to the compound...nursed him back to health...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Clare, I hate to quibble with your anthropological abilities...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Quibble.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: ...but if this little fellow is over 200 years old... I mean... What accounts for his youthful appearance?...his vitality?...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: There's nothing unusual about this ...nothing to indicate that it's from Sun Wu Kung's garden...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: This fruit fly had a normal life- span of TWENTY FOUR HOURS.  Until now.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Sorry.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: He understands him?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Ask Tyki where he came from.

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: He say... "I come from 'Land Of City On Clouds'".

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Can he take us there?

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: He say if he could... He would go back!

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: He say "Pai Cho" may help you.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: "Pai Cho"?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: The Sacres Proverbs and Writings of Sun Wu Kung.  His disciples always carry the Pai Cho with them...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Can you translate it?...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Get...him...off...of...me...!

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: "Sun Wu Kung run like fire, He journey to Many Monkey Land, To build his final empire."

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Who's Sun Wu-Kung?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Many Monkey Land... That's a definite reference to Africa.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Africa?... He journeyed to Africa?...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: That confirms our suspicions that he may have formed his Civilization here...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: What civilization?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Betsy. Keep your trap shut. This doesn't concern you.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: C'mon, Indy. Let's dance.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Later.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: What a buncha' stiffs!  Bet you can't dance.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Quite the contrary...I spent several months studying dance.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Oh yeah? Whattayou' know?... The Bunny Hop?... The Jitterbug?...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: The Bondogea. The Kyebe Kyebe. The Dungumaro.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Huh?

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: African Tribal dances.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Never heard of 'em.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Of course not. They're beyond the spectrum of your microscopic world.

Speaker: dashiell
Dialogue: Enjoying your dinners?...

Speaker: dashiell
Dialogue: Watch yourself, sport. Most of the talk here tonight is about you. And it isn't good.

Speaker: dashiell
Dialogue: I don't know what you've done to the Nazis. But they are certainly no friends of yours.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Who's there?...

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: "With his Golden Hooped Rod, And its powerful lightning rays, Sun Wu Kung build Water Curtain Cave, Where he live for 500 days."

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: The Golden Hooped Rod?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: A heavenly staff with many different powers...most notably, it had the ability to transform itself into hundreds of objects...  It remains the most priceless treasure of Sun Wu Kung's empire.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: And what is the...the Water Curtain Cave?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Sun Wu Kung's legendary hideout...an enormous secret cave, hidden behind a running waterfall.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: This proves that the Water Curtain Cave exists in Africa...  Does it mention anything about Sun Wu Kung's travels?

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Only place called..."Twisted Snake Water".

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: The Zarnbesi River! It has a reputation for its deadly water snakes...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: It would have been Sun Wu Kung's logical path.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: It will also be our logical path.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Please try to control that monstrous libido of yours!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: We have to get back to the compound. Tyki may be in danger.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Get your hands off him.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: When I tell you... Hit the brakes!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Now, Scraggy!

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: About time we had some fun!

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Bad spirits have Indy! He in trouble! Big trouble!

Speaker: gutterbuhg
Dialogue: Goodnight, Doctor Jones.

Speaker: dashiell
Dialogue: Scraggy said you might be needing some help, sport.

Speaker: dashiell
Dialogue: Indy! Rollout!

Speaker: dashiell
Dialogue: You okay, sport?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Dash!...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: What a romantic night!

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Will they hurt Tyki?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: They'll use him to bargain for this.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Indy, you smell so good! So masculine!

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Will they be following us?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Every step of the way.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Mmmm, Indy. I love it when you don't shave. It's so sexy!

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Pandoola, God of Purity, say... "Always stay ten paces ahead of bad spirit".

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Exactly. We can't let the Nazis get to the City first. If they do, they'll wipe out one of the greatest archeological finds in History!

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: How 'bout a little goodnight kiss?

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Mmmmm, Indy...you really know the way to a girl's heart!

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: What is that awful aroma?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Scraggy's takin' a shower.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: He believes that onions keep bad spirits from entering his body.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: In all my years of anthropology... I've never run across anyone or anything quite like Scraggy.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: You're looking very lovely.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: You're looking very lecherous.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Just tryin' to be friendly.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Save it for the schoolgirls.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Look, Clare... Betsy's just an anxious archeology student...she admires my work...  But it's just some kinda' hero worship thing...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: I dreamed about our first night together!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: You're writin' this down?...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: I'm keeping an accurate record of our journey.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: What's that got to do with my personal life?

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Evidence. I plan on testifying at your child molestation trial.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Why do I do this to myself?

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Hey, lady...you're s'posed to be a Doctor...you got any cures for a hangover?...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: The best I've heard was used by a New Zealand Tribe...  One part crushed owl skull...two parts rhino saliva...one part zebra dandruff.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: No, No... Get a cup of donkey sweat ...two spoons of skunk hair...and one pint of shredded lizard tongue.

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: I always use family cure! Two spoons chopped leeches... Half cup horse mucous...two quarts crocodile urine!

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Ex...cuse...me...!

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: How far we travel, Indy?...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Almost 20 miles.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Any sign of the Nazis?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Long as we keep up this pace... they'll have trouble tracking us.

Speaker: mephisto
Dialogue: We must leave. Immediately.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Don't you know somethin' else? Somethin' upbeat?...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: It's so hot... Stuffy... Do we have to stay on this stupid boat all night?...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: We have to keep moving.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Can we at least jump in the water?... Go for a swim?...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: There's an old legend about the Zambesi... In ancient times, criminals were given their choice of execution...or swimming across the Zambesi. Most chose execution.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Clare's right. We'll be safer on the boat.  Now quit moanin' and eat your food.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: You are so rude! I travel thousands of miles just to be with you...and everybody treats me like dirt!  'Cause whether you like it or not, Indiana Jones... I'm part of this expedition, too!

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: My friends also curious about where we journey to, Indy.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Tell us all a bedtime story, Doctor Jones.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Long ago...a place known as the Flower Fruit Mountain, in the Chinese province of Ao-Lai...was struck by lightning. A Stone Monkey, "Sun Wu-Kung", was born.

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: This monkey?... He could walk?... Talk?... Like human?...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: More than human. He was blessed with countless heavenly powers... But it wasn't enough. Sun Wu-Kung wanted to learn the secret of Eternal Life... of Immortality...  The exact whereabouts of that Lost City has been a mystery for hundreds of years...until Doctor Clarke discovered the pygmy.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: It's uncertain just how much of this legend is based in reality... Nevertheless, we're hoping to find some sign of the Lost Civilization.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: What about Sun Wu Kung?...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Whatever he was...a stone idol...an actual monkey...a human being...is unknown. But he is one of the most influentual religious figures in History, and his remains are most likely somewhere in the Lost City.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Sound familiar?

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: It is far, far away...many miles...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: What is it?... Some kinda' weird animal?...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: No animal sounds like that.

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Could be "Banseebaba".

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Banseebaba?

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Banseebaba is giant demon from hell. He is 50 feet tall. Breathes fire. Make sound like human never hear before. He is made up of all evil in the world!

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Cheery thought.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Whatever the hell it is... It went to sleep for the night. Which is what we should do.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Couldn't sleep. The heat. I'm in the mood for passion.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: I'm in the mood for isolation.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: I'm not leaving. Not till I get a kiss.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Betsy...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: One kiss. Or I'll scream. I swear. I'll wake the whole boat.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: OKay. Just one.  Keep your mouth closed.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: What's that you're writing?...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: "The Erotic Adventures Of Indiana Jones, Professor Of Perversity".

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Very funny.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: You are blowing this Betsy thing all out of proportion...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: It's not as if I have this sleazy reputation...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: I am a respected...honored... admired...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: C'mon... You ain't so tough. You wouldn't last ten minutes in Brooklyn.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: You son of a bitch.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Scraggy!... No!... Keep goin' straight!... Full steam ahead!...

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: What?... You crazy Indy?... We be crushed!... We smash into rock wall!...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: No!... Trust me!... Full steam ahead!... Full steam ahead !...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Wait...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Free the girl...  ...or I blow your hideout here out of the water!

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: Good. We will all die.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: We can take you to the Lost City of Sun Wu Kung!

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: Hah! Better men than you have tried to find the Lost City... They have all failed.  You are a fool.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: No... You're the fool. You and your friends are hiding out in Sun Wu Kung's Water Curtain Cave...and you don't even know it.

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: Huh?...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: The Sacred Pai-Cho Scroll.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Don't bother. Only WE can translate it.

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: The Lost City... Said to have streets paved in gold...treasures far greater than any mortal man could imagine...

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: Your pathetic lives will be spared. For now.  But everything we find in the Lost City...belongs to ME.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Fat chance, Sinbad. It's 50-50. Or you've got no deal.

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: It is my way. Or you've got no head.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Read that last proverb again...

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: "High tide drowns curiosity, Low tide quenches thirst".

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: There's something here...something that could help us...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Look at 'em. It's like they've never seen a woman before.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: To them... We're the ultimate women.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Kinda' flattering, isn't it?... Being the girl of 200 guy's dreams?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Is there an area... A place where the tide changes?...

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: In a few hours...the water will be lower...much lower...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: And the remainder of this wall will be visible?....

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: We're gonna need light. A lot of light. On this wall.

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: To my good fortune.

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: You know... We are very much alike, Doctor jones.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: I doubt that.

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: We both share a remarkable talent for killing.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: I've never gotten used to killing, pal. I do it for survival.

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: I do it for pleasure.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: This is incredible...this map was obviously used by Sun Wu Kung's disciples...if they were ever lost...

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: These drawings...they are of the surrounding jungle...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Where is that?...

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: It is located at the most South Eastern part of the jungle...near the mountains... There is a village there. The Mongooboo Tribe.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: You know them?

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: Very well. I traded with the chief for many years.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Good. We'll leave in the morning.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: That sound. Again.

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Still far away...but getting closer.

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: The village is there. Beyond the thick of jungle.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Thought you said they knew you?...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Wait... Listen... They're not following us...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Be careful where you step... We've got to move slowly...very slowly...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Clare! What are you...?!?

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: I imitated the sound of a Lion Mother calling her babies.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: C'mon. Let's get outta' --

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Is this the Tribal Chief you told me about?... Your friend?...

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: No. That is him.

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: This is a different tribe. New. They have taken over the village.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: What happened to the other tribe?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: You recognize their language?

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: I tell him we divine messengers of Sun Wu-Kung. If he interfere with our mission... Jade Emperor come down from heavens and destroy his village.

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: I tell him we lose path to city... I ask if he have something to help us.

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: He say this will help us. And since we are divine messengers...we will know how to use it!

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Indy. I'm frightened.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: I'm claustrophobic.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Clare!... Wait!...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: An earthquake?

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Wildebeest.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: We have to get out... Or we'll be crushed to death.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Scraggy... How close?

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Two miles.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Where's the softest ground?...

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Oh, no! Many dead spirits! Bad spirits... We must stay away...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: That's odd... Wildebeests will not stampede unless provoked...

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: This time, it is very close, Indy. Very close!

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Indy?... Indy?...

Speaker: gutterbuhg
Dialogue: Fire!

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Safest place from bad spirits...is in branches of tree.

Speaker: gutterbuhg
Dialogue: Send help! We need assistance!

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Indy in trouble! We must help!

Speaker: crew member
Dialogue: All of you. Stay where you are.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: It was you. You're the reason the Nazis found us.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Nobody move. Or we'll go over.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Jump!... Jump!...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Call your mommy.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: This is Jones. I've got your tank.  It's all over, pal. You lose.

Speaker: mephisto
Dialogue: Doctor Jones... You surprise me. For a supposedly intelligent man...you jump to childish conclusions. Remember... You are driving our tank. We can FOLLOW you anywhere.  You are far from defeating us, my friend. The battle has only just begun.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: We've got to move. Fast.  Ask him if he knows the way to the City from here.

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: He do not know exact place... But it is somewhere over there.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: A lotta' good that does us... It could take us months...years...to search everyone of those.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Maybe he knows what to do with this...

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: It is "Magical Mirror of Sun Wu Kung"...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: But whattayou do with it?

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: "I come from Land Of City On Clouds".

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: This is called "Taskipi". Only the bravest play.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: I've been talking to Dr. Clarke about our problem.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Problem?... Hey... What're you two doin' talkin' behind my back?...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Betsy needed help. I obliged.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Since when did you become the female Sigmund Freud?

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Since I received a Masters Degree in Psychology.

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: We play again?

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: The game is not yet over, my friend.

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Oh?

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: You have lost. You must pay.

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: I don't have money...

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: No. No. money.  A part of your body. Any part I wish.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Dr. Clarke says that you're not really in love with me. You're just trying to prove that you can still attract younger women. You're terrified of getting old.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: That's crazy.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: That's what I told her. I told her that you really did love me.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Well...that's...ah...well...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: You mean... She was right?...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: No... I mean Yes... I mean...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: No, Betsy. I don't love you.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: That's the first time you ever said it!

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: There. There. He's a very disturbed man.

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: Your eyes. They are a striking deep blue.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Enough. We're in this together. If we start fighting among ourselves... we'll never get out alive.

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: You owe me, old man.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Doctor Jones!!!

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: He say that two miles ahead...we will find his home.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: How do I work the big gun?

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Want your souvenir?  Start with his good arm.

Speaker: gutterbuhg
Dialogue: W-W-Wait!... Please!...

Speaker: gutterbuhg
Dialogue: There. That is what you want.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Tell him to take off my stuff!

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: He say... "Our Prince has returned home".

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: He thank us...for returning his son.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: If the little guy's pushin' 200 years?... How old's his Father?

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: His name "Bohbala". He is Ruler of City, faithful servant of his Lord and Master... Sun Wu-Kung.  He welcome us to stay. As long as we wish.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Ask him where we may find the burial place...or the remains...of Sun Wu- Kung...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Bastard...

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: It is written... If ruler is defeated by greater power...he who possess that power...  ...shall become ruler!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: This is turning into one helluva nightmare.

Speaker: gutterbubg
Dialogue: One you will never awaken from, Doctor Jones.

Speaker: gutterbuhg
Dialogue: I want to see Jones!

Speaker: gutterbuhg
Dialogue: Your friend makes a wonderful interpreter.

Speaker: gutterbuhg
Dialogue: "The Nazi Party will exist for one thousand years...and I wish to be alive for every year!"  That is a favorite philosophy of our feuher.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Your feuher's philosphies belong on a bathroom wall.

Speaker: gutterbuhg
Dialogue: I want information about this Garden... And I would greatly appreciate it, if you would share everything you know, with me.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: I don't share anything with Nazis.

Speaker: gutterbuhg
Dialogue: Very well. My friends will be here soon. They will rest...enjoy the pleasures of my newfound kingdom...  Then we shall exterminate these worthless people! Destroy their City! And we will carry away all of its riches...in pieces.

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: Sir... We shall reach the mountain top in less than sixty minutes.

Speaker: gutterbuhg
Dialogue: Doctor Jones... Those beasts are anxious to run wild. Free.  How long will you be able to ride... before they TEAR YOU IN TWO?

Speaker: gutterbuhg
Dialogue: Goodbye, Doctor Jones.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Heil Hitler!

Speaker: gutterbuhg
Dialogue: Heil Hitler!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Nazis'll be be here soon. We gotta move fast.

Speaker: mephisto
Dialogue: Idiot!... Why are you dressed like that!... Where is your uniform?...

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: They want you to give speech.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: What?!?...

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Before battle... General always give speech to inspire troops.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: General?... Who the hell do they think I am... Custer?...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Geez... The only speeches I remember are from college...when I played ball...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Men...and, ah...women... I...ah... We're about to face one of our toughest opponents... They've got size...hardware...and well, quite frankly...we're the underdogs...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: But...well, if it wasn't for the little guy...where would this country be?...  Now let's go out there and show 'em JUST HOW TOUGH THE LITTLE GUYS ARE!

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Do exactly what I do.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: I made the sound of a baby Swandola bird, crying for help... The Mother birds immediately reply to the cries ...angrily protecting their children, and murdering the baby's attackers.

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: You owe me, old man.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: He's...dead...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: But... It's... It's the middle of the night...

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Sun always shine in the Garden of Immortal Peaches.

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: These are the peaches that make one ...forever young?...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: What does it say?...

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: "Our Lord... Our Master... Sun... Wu... Kung"

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Damn you, Jones! Why couldn't you be here to share this with me!

Speaker: sun wu kung
Dialogue: We cannot bury these men!... This is a garden of life... Not of death!...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Why's he speakin' in English?

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: He is a heavenly being. According to legend, when a heavenly being speaks, men of all countries can understand him. We hear him in English...the pygmies hear him in their language.

Speaker: sun wu kung
Dialogue: Return their souls!... I demand it!... Return their souls!

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: What the hell's goin' on?

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: I think there is someone you should meet...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: You... You're... Sun Wu Kung?...

Speaker: sun wu kung
Dialogue: You are... Indiana Jones?...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Huh?... You know me?

Speaker: sun wu kung
Dialogue: I have watched you for many, many years...from the heavens. I was fascinated by your bravery...your passion...in searching for me.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Well, I... Thanks I'm very honored.

Speaker: sun wu kung
Dialogue: The honor is mine, Doctor Jones. You and your friends have saved my city from ruin.  I would like to return the favor.

Speaker: sun wu kung
Dialogue: The Golden Hooped Rod will be a faithful friend. It is capable of one hundred transformations...and will always remain by your side.

Speaker: sun wu kung
Dialogue: I will explore the heavens for another. Surely, my search will be shorter and less hazardous than yours!

Speaker: sun wu kung
Dialogue: With my city alive again...I will be able to return to the heavens.  Goodbye...my dear friends.

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: She is a wonderful treasure... Eh?...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: We had a deal.

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: I have no deals with dead men.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Son of a bitch.

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: I am an old Pirate, Doctor Jones. Do you suddenly expect me to treat you with kindness and fairness?... It is not my way of life!

Speaker: kezure
Dialogue: Kill them...  But save their hair. I will make a coat out of it.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: I thought the peaches promised immortality...eternal youth?...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: The garden of immortal peaches promises life only to those who are pure in heart.  Kezure was evil. His heart was filled with greed.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Where's Betsy?... The boat leaves in five minutes...

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Oh, Indy! Indy! I want to give you something for your journey!

Speaker: scraggy
Dialogue: Take one drink before bed. It keep out all bad spirits.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Thanks, Scraggy...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Where're your bags?

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: I'm not leaving.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Huh?... But, you... You have to finish school.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: I'm staying on as Clare's assistant.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: But you're MY assistant.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Not any more. I'm having my credits transfered.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Why?...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Clare is a brilliant teacher.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: So am I.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Yes, but I don't offer a course in seduction.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: You stay out of this.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Indy... I thought you wanted me out of your life...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: That was before I realized how gifted...how talented you are... I mean... I could really use you...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Especially aboard ship for three weeks. It gets terribly lonely.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: I warned you...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Indy, I've learned a lot from you. But it's time I started concentrating on a career in anthropology...instead of romance.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: You've certainly developed a mature attitude.

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: You know... I always thought of you as my knight in shining armor...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: But now, I'll think of you as the Father I never had.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Terrific.

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Doctor Jones...although your libido is questionable, your bravery and intelligence are exceptional.  It has been an honor working with you.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: Why... Thanks.

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: You know, Clare...there's something...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: ...something I've been wanting to do...

Speaker: clare
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: indiana
Dialogue: ...since we first met...

Speaker: betsy
Dialogue: Sorry. Guess I left her cage open... she followed us.
